WRITING.TITLE: Drunk fish convince sober ones to follow them around.

WRITING.TEXT:
Thanks for letting me know. Looks like it was published in Nature Photonics.
Link from the bottom of the article:
http://www.nature.com/nphoton/journal/vaop/ncurrent/full/nphoton.2014.95.html

WRITING.TITLE: Scientists discover how to turn light into matter after 80-year quest

WRITING.TEXT: Adorable. I wonder if she also stepped around Mrs. Peabody's azaleas.

WRITING.TITLE: Gluten intolerance may not exist: A double-blinded, placebo-controlled study and a scientific review find insufficient evidence to support non-celiac gluten sensitivity.
Archaeologists think they've found the wreck of Christopher Columbus' flagship, the Santa Maria.
Researchers induce lucid dreaming in subjects by applying electrical current to their brains. The technique could potentially be adapted to allow PTSD sufferers to control frequent nightmares.
New research explains why Antarctica is not warming as much as the other continents.
New species of metal-eating plant discovered in the Philippines
A new analysis in PLoS ONE finds that female genitalia in the animal kingdom are massively understudied, which likely stems from aged sexual stereotypes.
Researchers image the spread of pesticides in snails and shrimp in order to understand how they are affecting these aquatic species.
Public science funding generates substantial returns to the private sector, a new report claims.
Are You Really Gluten-Intolerant? Maybe Not.
Chiropractors' spine-chilling warnings about computers, phones and pancakes

A review of archaeological records shows that Neanderthals were just as advanced as humans, making it increasingly likely that they were assimilated into our species through interbreeding, not driven to extinction.
New study shows the first functional replacement of muscle tissue in humans. Surgeons implanted extracellular matrix derived from pig bladder into wounds. Over time, muscle grew around it.
Scientists have built an 'off switch' for the brain. Their technique uses light sensitive proteins to shut down neurons.
Birds in areas with high radiation contamination around Chernobyl produce more antioxidants. It's the first known example of wild animals adapting to chronic radiation exposure.

WRITING.TEXT: I see your point and raise you a "shit ton."

WRITING.TITLE: Scientists have long wondered why our atmosphere has so little of the noble gas Xenon. They've just found a whole bunch of it in Earth's core.
Arecibo Observatory Detects Mysterious, Energetic Radio Burst

WRITING.TEXT:
It looks like the link is at the bottom of the article: http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/vaop/ncurrent/full/nature13027.html
The research is in Nature, so it's paywalled, obviously.

WRITING.TITLE: A possible cure for ebola virus infection has been discovered. A molecule called BCX4430 rescued 17 of 18 monkeys after they were infected with the virus.
Another reason not to use Apple Maps...

WRITING.TEXT: Sure thing! Sorry, I didn't read the new rules. Whoops.

WRITING.TITLE: Ten things you might not know about particle accelerators
Would You Have Sex with a Total Stranger? An Inside Look at the Study That Found Out.
Scientists have shown they can rapidly produce large quantities of graphene using a bath of inorganic salts and an electric current. It's a step towards mass production of the wonder material.
Intravenously Administered Ketamine Shown to Reduce Symptoms of Chronic Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
Cannabis use is quantitatively associated with nucleus accumbens and amygdala abnormalities in young adult recreational users.
Astronomers Find First Earth-Sized Exoplanet in Habitable Zone
Men's beard fashions may be guided by Darwinian selection. Both beards and clean-shaven faces become more appealing when they are rare.
Positron emission tomography, a type of brain scan, could help predict if patients will wake from a vegetative state.
By tracking brain activity when an animal stops to look around its environment, neuroscientists at Johns Hopkins University believe they can mark the birth of a memory.
For a Happy Marriage, Stay Well Fed: Low blood glucose levels correlate to greater levels of aggression and anger between spouses.
Two research teams have unveiled a quantum-information analogue of the transistor, a major step towards the development of practical quantum computers
If he looks stupid, he probably is: In a new study, both males and females were able to accurately evaluate the intelligence of men simply by viewing photos of their faces.
Positive Association of Video Game Playing with Left Frontal Cortical Thickness in Adolescents
69% of respondents support extending disability protections to obese individuals, according to a new survey.
New study reveals the power and scale of Earth's cataclysmic collision with a 30-mile-wide object some 3.26 billion years ago.
10 of the Greatest Myths in Psychology
A new study highlights that people are often mistaken in how spending our money might benefit our lives.
